intro: Lyperia dinteri, commonly known as the Dinter's lyperia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. It is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
